intro: Pentagonia macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf pentagonia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
